It took nearly 3 years to get out of it. He knew I had real panic and anxiety, yet he made it very difficult. To top it all, I‚Äôm disabled and he wanted me out on the street.

comment: I followed and admired Johnny Depp and his career ever since I, as a young teenager  had a crush on him in 21jump street. I always liked his choise of girlfriends, even though he and Kate Moss seemed to have had quite a turbulent time together. They should perhaps not have ended up together,  though I think they, at the time being maybe were just to much alike. Two young uprising stars with everything that comes along with it. But I never had anything against Moss, and maybe if they both had been more mature they would have worked out just fine together. They both calmed down and seattle down with families as they grow older. I think Depp even defended Moss on some occasion when she was in some trouble later on. When he and Vanessa Paradise became a couple I thought they were a perfect match. It was so romantic and they looked so happy qute, and fit for eachother. Even if their separation as I understand it, was a very peacful and agreeble one, I am almost ashamed to admit (and I think it is the only time it's happened to me, concerning any celebraties) I was a bit upset. I never thought those two of all would go separate ways. But when he then later on hocked up with. A, I did not have a good feeling at all. Every other woman he had, had a certain charisma, charactair, and personality. A kind of deepth in her. Just like Deep. But I had a straight away feeling of A being shallow, insincere and "plain" comparing to his previous women. Even though I don't deny her beautiful appearance, something was just off and she didn't fit Depps usual choice of Women, that I always thought he had a good judgement off. I feel a  bit silly expressing secret thoughts I never ever mentioned before. I mean who am I far north in Sweden, giving opinions about  people  I don't even know or have ever meet. But the reason I comment is what was said in the video about Depps family and their dislike of her. I guess Depps mother had a good intuition. And I see Deeps concern and caring for his mother as such a beautiful thing. I s√∂nder really how he ended up with this woman. At first I guessed he was blinded by her youth and bea√πtiful outside. But now I think she is a real narcissist. Perhaps even a steps further. And I know from experiences, that if those People really target someone, You can believe as much as You want, they Will not fool You, that You are able to decern and ser through their manipulation. But sooner or later they Will have You hocked. They are like a certain kind of breed suffering from the same collective insanity, but with an incredible talent for manipulation and to get what they want. Out of complete counsiusless and selfish motives.

comment:
Johnny Depp Hit With Costly Assault Suit By ‚ÄòCity Of Lies‚Äô Location Manager

Dominic Patten

July 9, 2018 1:30PM PDT


AP

Facing legal action from ex-business managers ex-lawyers¬†and ex-bodyguards¬†plus¬†foreclosure filings¬†and what could be an embarrassing trial later this summer,¬†Johnny Depp¬†has now been hit with an assault and battery lawsuit from the location manager of the upcoming¬†City of Lies.

The actor allegedly hit Gregg ‚ÄúRocky‚Äù Brooks repeatedly on April 13, 2017 after being informed that DTLA filming on the¬†Brad Furman¬†helmed pic about the LAPD investigation into the 1997 murder of the Notorious B.I.G. was going to have to wrap up late that night. Hesitant to approach Depp after Furman told him to, the vet location manager went to speak instead to the on-set off duty LAPD officer about the matter. That conversation was seemingly cut short when the apparently booze on the breath¬†Pirates of the Caribbean¬†star supposedly start screaming obscenities at Brooks and proceeded to strike him ‚Äútwice in the lower left side of his rib cage and causing pain.‚Äù

Related Story

Johnny Depp Loses Bid To Delay $25M Fraud Trial On Heels Of Train Wreck Rolling Stone Profile

‚ÄúDespite having just been punched in the side, PLAINTIFF maintained his composure,‚Äù says the 10-claim complaint filed in LA Superior Court on July 6 (read it here). ‚ÄúWhen PLAINTIFF did not react to DEPP‚Äôs satisfaction after being punched, DEPP yelled ‚ÄúI WILL GIVE YOU ONE HUNDRED THOUSAND DOLLARS TO PUNCH ME IN THE FACE RIGHT NOW!‚Äù PLAINTIFF still did not react and DEPP continued to scream and berate him in front of a set full of people until DEPP‚Äôs own bodyguards physically removed DEPP from the scene.‚Äù

Brooks‚Äô filing from Glendale attorney Arbella Azizian of Baker Olson, LeCroy & Danielian seeks wide ranging but unspecified damages from Depp, Furmqn, producer Miriam Segal and the production. And it‚Äôs not just for the alleged assault but wrongful termination and retailation as well.

‚Äú0n the Monday following the incident, April 16, 2017, PLAINTIFF returned to the production office to work on wrapping out the show,‚Äù the 14-page filing adds damningly.‚ÄùUpon arrival, PLAINTIFF was informed that SEGAL wanted him to write and sign a declaration stating that he would not sue the PRODUCTION. When PLAINTIFF declined to write such a statement, his services were terminated immediately.‚Äù

‚ÄúMy client wants to make sure Mr. Depp is held accountable for his conduct on set so that, in the future, others will not be put in the same situation,‚Äù Azizian told Deadline today.

Co-starring Forest Whitaker,¬†City of Lies¬†is set to be¬†released on September 7,¬†which would have been the 46th birthday of B.I.G. AKA Christopher Wallace. That date is just over two weeks after the August 15 trial on Depp‚Äôs¬†January 2017 filed¬†$25 million fraud lawsuit against his former business managers The Management Group is scheduled to start. Having failed to pushed the matter back, which is unusual for a plaintiff, more stories of the actor‚Äôs excessive spending and empty accounts are expected to be on display.

With a countersuit from TMG also in play¬†as well as a countersuit¬†from the Hollywood Vampire bandmember‚Äôs former lawyer¬†Jacob Bloom¬†and his Bloom Hergott Diemer Rosenthal LaViolette Feldman Schenkman & Goodman LLP firm over Depp‚Äôs $30 million action against the attorneys, this latest action further portrays an individual sliding out of control. An impression certainly spotlighted by ex-bodyguards¬†Eugene Arreola and Miguel Sanchez‚Äôs May filed multi-claim lawsuit over unpaid wages and working conditions ‚Äì which claimed the use of¬† ‚Äúillegal substances‚Äù by Depp and ‚Äúbeing¬†forced to protect Defendant Depp from himself and his vices while in public.‚Äù.

None of which can be pleasing to the now AT&T-owned Warner Bros, which has the Depp starring¬†Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald¬†coming out in November.

Reps for Johnny Depp did not respond to request for comment on the Brooks‚Äô suit.
